storyInfo: Hibiscus learns some of the Afterglow's history; Ebenholz is about to detain his target, but an agent suddenly appears, giving the rumor-spreader an opportunity to flee into the sewers. The two give chase.

attributes.content: Who are you?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I told you not to turn around. You let the mark get away.
I said, who the hell are you?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Easy now, my dear Graf. Settle down.
My official identity can be a bit messy to explain, so just treat me as a spy. I am called Biegler.
You... Why'd you have to jump out this exact moment? That man escaped because of YOU!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Considering he ended up down in the sewers, it'll take him a long time to find another exit.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Besides, you stopped him before he went into the sewer. Who knows, maybe the two of you saw that you were in a disadvantageous position and tried to put on a little show to try to fool me.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You seriously think we're in cahoots? He and I?!
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Or are you going to tell me that someone coerced you into going to see Gertrude? Spare me the bad jokes.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You're worth much more than he is, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: You can't stop me.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: When it comes to combat ability, it is true that I can't stop you. But think carefully.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: This is a job straight from Their Majesties. Take a look.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I've dealt with these things since I was six.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I personally don't mind your snark, but you'd best show some self-restraint when it comes to Their Majesties' affairs.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Restraint? When you, a lowly spy, figure out that you've got the wrong person, you're going to be the one begging for forgiveness.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You don't seem to understand the situation you're in, my good Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: But enough of that. Don't try to stall for time here. Come with me.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Where to?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: To where you belong. Don't worry, we've prepared detention facilities for suspects from all walks of life. I assure you, you'll enjoy the finest treatment.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Let me tell you something, Herr Biegler.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ready to beg for mercy? Or is it a bribe? In case of the latter, I'd be more than glad to oblige.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I doubt a little bit of money is enough for you to let me go. Why do I get the impression that you'd take me away regardless, even after you pocketed the money?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Clever boy.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I find you rather easy to get along with, Herr Biegler. You remind me of the Urtica I know so well, where most of the people are just as 'upstanding' as you.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I am honored to hear that.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: But what I really want to know is what that man is doing in the sewers.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: But you were the one who stopped him, right under my nose.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Well, this is a bit embarrassing to say, but I wanted to resolve things up here.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: One of my agents liked to tell stories that would make you want to hurl. Of the ones that instantly killed your appetite for the day, the worst all came from the sewers.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Ah. If your stomach is upset, perhaps we should go for a cup of coffee to smooth things over.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I'd love to, but I'd much rather find out what he's doing down there. I might as well go after him.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: And this is all your fault, Herr Biegler.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: As long as you let me head down, you can keep pointing your wand at me. I won't try to run.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: I will warn you in advance—There will be consequences for running away from me without authorization, regardless of the reason.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: What kind? Will you put me down?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: You'd at least be stripped of your status. Even if you're proven innocent in the future, you'd never be able to step into the Spire of Urtica ever again.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Don't threaten me with a good time. I might be even more inclined to try running now.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: (Shakes head)
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: In any case, since you insist on heading down there... After you, Graf Urtica.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: I'll be keeping a close eye on you.
attributes.name: Biegler

attributes.content: Hibiscus, this isn't a lecture, but y'can't speak to Mein Herr that way.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: But, Mr. Czerny is...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: There's lots of things he can't say, leavin' this old lady to say 'em.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Please come in.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Do you know how the Afterglow got its name?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: I don't.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Mein Herr once said...
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: 'It is precisely because night falls, that the afterglow is even more precious. If the long veil of night were to never lift, what could be more dazzling and awe-inspiring than the warm afterglow?'
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: It's a wonderful saying, but...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oh, the two over there are–– Frau Ursula, and Hibiscus?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Come, come! If you want to chat, do it over here!
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Why the long face, Hibiscus? Did something happen?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: If you're worried that my food isn't healthy enough, I also have sparkling water here. Come, come!
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: We're still––
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Let's oblige him this time.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Frau Ursula, what's wrong with Hibiscus? Did she get into an argument?
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: No, none of that. Enough random guessing.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: I was telling Hibiscus about the history of the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: The Afterglow's history? Now that's something I couldn't be more familiar with.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Not bragging either. But I bet I know even more than Frau Ursula here.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: The Afterglow didn't used to be a residential area for the Infected. It was one of Vyseheim's industrial plates.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Don't underestimate me just because I'm setting up shop over here. Back in the day, I was in charge of feeding hundreds of associates.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Industry... Could it be that this place was turned into an Infected residential area because of the spread of Oripathy due to industrial waste?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Industrialization did bring a lot of Infected here, but back in Leithanien's old days, there was no such thing as a ghetto for Infected... Hah, I won't keep rambling on.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: One year, Vyseheim constructed a magnificent concert hall that shocked the world with but a single order from Him, His Majesty... known now as our Afterglow Hall. Back then, that's not what the concert hall was called.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: His Majesty? Which one are you referring to?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oh dear, Hibiscus, let's not worry about the details, alright?
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: If it's 'His' Majesty...
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: ...I get it.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: When the concert hall was completed, 'He' still reigned, and nobody dared to say anything.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: But He left us just as quickly, and Graf Strollo, who took over Vyseheim, hated this concert hall.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Maybe hate isn't the right word, but rather... was too quick to show loyalty?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Shh–– No random guessing.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: A few years later, the powers issued an order to supposedly improve the treatment of the Infected. The Graf at that time took the opportunity to lump the concert hall together with the industrial plate, and turned it all into the Infected ghetto.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: I looked all over and before that, there were no such things as 'Infected quarters' anywhere in Leithanien.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: The Count, the Graf, at that time... Wasn't that the very same Dame Gertrude?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It was either her father–– or her oldest brother... I can't really remember, but it wasn't actually her.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Though the Graf at the time designated this area for the Infected, he didn't care whether the people in it lived or died. He even had all the industrial facilities torn down.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Obviously, to have us fend for ourselves.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: So among the nobles, this place became known as 'the Afterglow,' and the concert hall also became the 'Afterglow Hall.'
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: The name, 'Afterglow,' represented the idea that we wouldn't last long, just like the last rays of light in the evening.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: That... That's simply cruel and unusual.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: It was pretty over-the-top.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: But for the Afterglow at the time, that word was a perfect fit.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Everyone fought desperately to survive, to let the lingering rays of sunlight on the horizon struggle for just a bit longer.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: We set up stalls, we ran errands. Some of us even turned into hired thugs for rich people in the other plates... Hah, those were some chaotic years.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Later on, Herr Czerny stepped forward.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Stepped forward?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: He started out as a nobody.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: He had written a few pieces, but since he was an Infected, everything was published anonymously.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: His works were magnificent, even attracting attention from the fancy folk atop the spires. But once they saw that Herr Czerny was from the Afterglow, they quickly turned away and left.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: That was until he wrote 'Morgen und Abend.'
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Ursula would be more qualified to speak about 'Morgen und Abend' than me, so I'll turn the floor over to her.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Ms. Ursula?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Oh, it's actually quite simple.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: The one who taught piano to Mein Herr had a daughter, and she was good friends with him.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: The two were on very good terms, and they were just about as good as each other. They were awfully competitive, always trying to one-up the other.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Sadly, the girl passed away when Mein Herr was twenty years old.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Losing her was a huge blow to him. Day in n' day out, he spoke hardly a word. He grew thinner and thinner by the day.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Until finally, he showed a stack of sheet music, told me it's his newest composition, and that he wasn't gonna publish anonymously this time.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: The Gräfin then–– she was the very same Dame you mentioned.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Still don't know why, by the Gräfin sought out Mein Herr.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: She became his sponsor, and also went 'long with all his ideas. She gave him her full backing, finally lettin' 'Morgen und Abend' carry the Czerny, and spread it all throughout the Afterglow.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: I can't imagine that.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But I'm starting to understand a bit of what Mr. Czerny meant in his saying...
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: 'Morgen und Abend' was so popular and beloved, the folk in the spires couldn't blind eye anymore. They had no choice, they had to acknowledge Mein Herr's talent.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: So then, Mr. Czerny began to cultivate people in the Afterglow who had musical talent?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: That's right. Seeing as how we are in Leithanien, the one thing we aren't short on is musicians! I may not have any talent, but even I...
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Oh stop it, you're just being humble.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: A few years ago you were still playin' the accordion while yodelin' about your pickled cabbage.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Haha, back in my factory days, I had to gather everyone up for lunch. Way easier to use an accordion than to shout.
attributes.name: Food Stall Owner

attributes.content: Anyway, once music became a part of the Afterglow, our worst days finally passed.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Composin', performin', teachin', makin' instruments...
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Plenty of folk publish their compositions anonymously, and most performers can't leave the Afterglow. But still, the money it brought in gave the Afterglow a foot in the door.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: But before long, Mein Herr got into some big fight with the Gräfin.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: A big fight?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Looked like a clash of ideas... not that understand such things.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: The Gräfin stayed the Herr's patron, but the two have hardly made contact since.
attributes.name: Ursula

attributes.content: Andante? What's wrong?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Kreide's grandfather... he's gone missing?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: I'll head back right away!
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: Thank you very much! See you!
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Goodbye, hope to see you again! If anything doesn't fit quite right, bring it back and I'll fix it for you!
attributes.name: Tailor Store Owner

attributes.content: (It's already so late... Ebenholz should be back by now, right?)
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: Huh, what is that...?
attributes.name: Kreide

attributes.content: An Originium slug?
attributes.name: Kreide
